content: 1. Why are you doing a "fresh install"? 2. Do you mean an wipe our your data and install Thunderbird again? 3. You always need your primary password, even to start Thunderbird. And you need it to be able to view the passwords you have protected. If you don't know it then you need to know all your other passwords.
creator: wsmwk

content: The app password is for the equipment being used or for an insecure App so you would need another for a different machine. At least, that's the way it works in Gmail "https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/185833?hl=en"

content: In TB, you have the email profiles at the top in the lh pane and the offline folders in a separate place below them. You can make folders here and then click-drag the files into them to make a local copy.
creator: arlev

content:
I don't see a Local Folders entry in the left-hand pane; not sure if that matters.

It does. Did you rename the Local Folders account at some point, or did you attempt to delete it?

Also, please post your Troubleshooting Information. At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button , then select Help > Troubleshooting Information. Press the "Copy text to clipboard button" and paste the information into your reply.
creator: christ1

content: Have you got the 'Dark Mode' set on the OS? TB settings are at Settings/General/Language and Appearance/Colors
creator: arlev

content:
Hello Arlev,

The OS was not on "Dark Mode activated".

I found the source of the problem : last week-end, I installed Cinnamon Desktop to test it. After that, each time I opened a session (in Gnome, Gnome Classical or in Cinnamon), Thunderbird was in Dark Mode. Some of Cinnamon's packages was blocking Thunderbird in Dark Mode. I remove Cinnamon Desktop and everything is OK now.

Thank your for your help.
creator: kidcreole38

Server settings are under Account Settings/[Account Name] They can then be changed on the rhs

The password tutorial is here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/password-manager-remember-delete-change-tb

content:
Translation - Password

Passwords are what you set up with your email provider and are not supplied by Mozilla or Thunderbird.

Lösenord är vad du ställer in med din e-postleverantör och tillhandahålls inte av Mozilla eller Thunderbird.

content: Do you also see two accounts on the account settings pane? Each account in thunderbird is independent of other accounts.
